activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob P. Achterberg

records.addlTxt:
1:51 PM Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jacob P. Achterberg. Attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Krista Cannon appearing under student practice rules. Calling 22CF159, 22CF168 & 22CF172. Cannon States Defendant doing well - is working - would like to set out. Sowinski has no objection. Court questions Defendant on employment. Bond continued. adj. 01:54 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court. Calling 22CF159, 22CF168 & 22CF172. Magallones states she will be appointed. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 03:06 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant allowed on Rodeway in with attached conditions/all other conditions remain (mailed to Rodeway Inn for signature)
Letter from Defendant w/response - bond condition
No intoxicants/No taverns/Go to hospital to get medicine - take as directed- bring verification to next hearing/Not to be within 500 feet of hotel

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant statement to counsel on prior case. Court questions Defendant on address/residence/will be staying with brother or in hic car - going to get medicine for drinking. Sowinski statement to bail. Significant other appearing in court - states Defendant will be staying in car - was evicted and staying in motel. Court sets bond. Case to transfer to Branch II. Must bring verification of medicine to next hearing. adj. 01:53 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
